metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6207 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in the _gdContributionsAlloc function ingd_interpolation.c in GD Graphics Library (aka libgd) before 2.2.3 allowsremote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds memory writeor memory consumption) via unspecified vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6207` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgd-tools - 2.1.0-3ubuntu0.3
libgd3 - 2.1.0-3ubuntu0.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libgd2 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.0-3ubuntu0.3').
